response: "{ \"title\": \"[Easy] Sum of Squares\", \"description\": \"Write a function `sum_squares` that takes an integer n as input and returns the sum of the squares of all numbers from 1 to n. The function should use list comprehension for generating the list of squares.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef sum_squares(n: int) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): A positive integer.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns an integer that is the sum of the squares of all numbers from 1 to n.\", \"code\": \"def sum_squares(n: int) -> int:\\n    return sum([i**2 for i in range(1, n+1)])\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert sum_squares(1) == 1\", \"assert sum_squares(2) == 5\", \"assert sum_squares(3) == 14\", \"assert sum_squares(4) == 30\"] }"
